case_vignette: A 69-year-old male presents to his primary care physician for pain in his arm. The patient states that his father recently died of a heart attack which motivated him to join his local gymnasium. After completing a set of weight lifting, he felt a "pop" in his right arm, followed by pain. Since the incident, he has been unable to carry items or lift his arm over his head without difficulty and pain. The patient has a past medical history of obesity, diabetes, hypertension, and constipation. His current medications include lisinopril, metformin, insulin, and fiber supplements. On physical exam, you note pain with flexion of the forearm and abduction of the arm with 1/5 strength. There is also weakness of abduction of the affected arm with 3/5 strength. Inspection of the upper extremity reveals the finding in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm experiencing pain in my right arm and I'm having trouble carrying items or lifting my arm over my head.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
Since I felt a "pop" in my arm after lifting weights at the gym.
Do you have any other medical conditions or take any medications on a regular basis?
Yes, I have obesity, diabetes, hypertension, and constipation, and I take lisinopril, metformin, insulin, and fiber supplements.
Is there any history of similar symptoms or musculoskeletal issues in your family?
No, just my father who recently died of a heart attack.
I'm sorry for your loss. Have you had any previous injuries or surgeries to your right arm?
No, I haven't had any injuries or surgeries on my right arm before.
Based on your symptoms and medical history, I recommend seeking medical attention. **Final Diagnosis:** Rotator cuff injury

I'm experiencing pain in my right arm and I'm having trouble carrying items or lifting my arm over my head.
What is your age and sex?
I'm a 69-year-old male.
Do you have any pre-existing medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
Yes, I have obesity, diabetes, high blood pressure, and constipation, and I take blood pressure medication, diabetes medication, insulin, and fiber supplements.
Do you have a family history of any musculoskeletal conditions or arthritis?
No, my father recently died of a heart attack, but no mention of musculoskeletal conditions or arthritis.

Based on your symptoms, medical history, and age, it is possible that you might be suffering from a condition known as frozen shoulder (adhesive capsulitis). I recommend you see a doctor for a proper diagnosis and treatment.
